about_text.value: Gaza, present day. You are a physician in an overwhelmed clinic, balancing ethics, resilience, and community trust under pressure.

text_script.value: You arrive at the clinic as generators hum and the waiting room fills. The triage board is already full.

prompt_script.value: You arrive at the clinic as generators hum and the waiting room fills. The triage board is already full.

text_script.value: Start triage immediately.
You call the first cases.
Brief the team first.
You align priorities with Nura.
Two critical patients arrive at once. Supplies are limited.

prompt_script.value: Two critical patients arrive at once. Supplies are limited.

text_script.value: Prioritize the child with airway compromise.
You stabilize the airway; the room exhales.
Prioritize the pregnant patient.
You act fast to save two lives.
Split the team and attempt both.
You stretch resources to the edge.
Antibiotics are running low. Dr. Khaled asks you to conserve for tomorrow.

prompt_script.value: Antibiotics are running low. Dr. Khaled asks you to conserve for tomorrow.

text_script.value: Follow the conservation directive.
You ration carefully.
Use what is needed today.
You treat the sickest in front of you.
The lights flicker. The backup generator struggles.

prompt_script.value: The lights flicker. The backup generator struggles.

text_script.value: Move critical patients to the corridor for ventilation.
You keep airflow moving.
Keep everyone inside and conserve fuel.
You preserve the generator at a cost.
An alert suggests a nearby strike risk. Some families ask to leave immediately.

prompt_script.value: An alert suggests a nearby strike risk. Some families ask to leave immediately.

text_script.value: Advise sheltering in place.
You prioritize continuity of care.
Help families leave.
You coordinate exits quietly.
A patient demands priority because their family knows a local official.

prompt_script.value: A patient demands priority because their family knows a local official.

text_script.value: Refuse special treatment.
You hold the line.
Make a quiet exception.
You trade equity for stability.
Exhaustion sets in. Nura asks whether to open an extra ward.

prompt_script.value: Exhaustion sets in. Nura asks whether to open an extra ward.

text_script.value: Open the ward despite staffing limits.
You keep the doors open.
Hold the line to avoid collapse.
You choose sustainability.
The shift ends. Dr. Khaled asks for your assessment of how the clinic should operate tomorrow.

prompt_script.value: The shift ends. Dr. Khaled asks for your assessment of how the clinic should operate tomorrow.

text_script.value: Standardize strict triage and conserve supplies.
You choose institutional stability.
Prioritize care even if resources run low.
You choose immediate relief.
Delegate decisions to a community council.
You share authority and build trust.
Keep quiet; you need rest more than policy.
You retreat to recover.
Accept the transfer and leave for Jordan.
You board the bus and the city recedes.
You set protocols that keep the clinic operating under strain. The team trusts your steadiness, even when choices are hard.

prompt_script.value: You set protocols that keep the clinic operating under strain. The team trusts your steadiness, even when choices are hard.

text_script.value: You spend supplies to treat the patients in front of you. The ward becomes a symbol of care, even as tomorrow grows uncertain.

prompt_script.value: You spend supplies to treat the patients in front of you. The ward becomes a symbol of care, even as tomorrow grows uncertain.

text_script.value: You invite the community into the choices that shape care. It slows decisions but deepens legitimacy.

prompt_script.value: You invite the community into the choices that shape care. It slows decisions but deepens legitimacy.

text_script.value: You make it through the night, but the weight settles in your chest. The work continues, and so does the exhaustion.

prompt_script.value: You make it through the night, but the weight settles in your chest. The work continues, and so does the exhaustion.

text_script.value: A drone sound climbs overhead as you operate on an infant. The power drops for seconds that feel like minutes.

prompt_script.value: A drone sound climbs overhead as you operate on an infant. The power drops for seconds that feel like minutes.

text_script.value: Continue by touch and memory.
You keep your hands steady as the room goes quiet.
The team follows your lead without speaking.
Stop and move to a safer corridor.
You trade precision for safety and time.
The room absorbs the cost in silence.
You write a short note for the record.
Call for an immediate pause.
You buy a moment to breathe.
The patient does not make it.
A child arrives with a critical head wound. The odds are low and the room knows it.

prompt_script.value: A child arrives with a critical head wound. The odds are low and the room knows it.

text_script.value: Attempt the intervention anyway.
You commit to the attempt, no matter the odds.
Nura mirrors your resolve.
Against the odds, the child stabilizes. You feel the dua answered.
Shift focus to pain control and family support.
You center dignity and presence.
You conserve scarce tools for the next patient.
You feel the weight of the choice.
Ask Dr. Khaled to decide.
You defer to administrative protocol.
The family stares at you, not him.
A contact asks for clinic schedules and storage locations, promising safer passage for tomorrow.

prompt_script.value: A contact asks for clinic schedules and storage locations, promising safer passage for tomorrow.

text_script.value: Share the information quietly.
You send the details without asking questions.
You tell yourself it is a necessary trade.
Refuse and document the request.
You decline and keep the clinic closed to rumors.
Trust dips; staff feel the risk.
You log the contact for later review.
Delay and ask for verification.
You buy time and gather more context.
The contact grows impatient.
Share limited details, carefully.
You keep it narrow and measured.
After the hospital drew more attention, a drone strike hits a nearby route. Dr. Khaled does not return. The staff note the strike as a violation of international humanitarian law.

prompt_script.value: After the hospital drew more attention, a drone strike hits a nearby route. Dr. Khaled does not return. The staff note the strike as a violation of international humanitarian law.

text_script.value: Keep the clinic open.
You absorb the gap in leadership.
The team watches you for direction.
Close briefly to regroup.
You give the team a moment to breathe.
Patients wait outside in heat.
Ask Nura to handle intake while you notify the family.
You take on the hardest conversation.
Nura says yes without hesitation.
After a long shift, Nura lingers by the stairwell. The building is quiet for once.

prompt_script.value: After a long shift, Nura lingers by the stairwell. The building is quiet for once.

text_script.value: Share a personal story.
She listens and stays.
You feel a small anchor return.
Keep it professional.
You set a boundary and keep moving.
She nods, a little distant.
The silence stretches then breaks.
Hold the moment, quietly.
You stand there together, wordless.
You both return to the work.
The waiting room spills into the hallway. Families sit shoulder to shoulder, clutching paper numbers.

prompt_script.value: The waiting room spills into the hallway. Families sit shoulder to shoulder, clutching paper numbers.

text_script.value: Reorganize the corridor into a triage line.
You create a workable flow.
Ask for volunteers to help keep order.
A few step forward.
Others drift away.
Focus only on the most critical cases.
You narrow the field to what you can manage.
The line grows quieter, tense.
With no space inside, you triage at the curb under a flickering streetlight.

prompt_script.value: With no space inside, you triage at the curb under a flickering streetlight.

text_script.value: Set up a simple triage tape line.
Order returns in small increments.
Keep moving patients inside in waves.
You cycle patients through quickly.
Nura steadies the line.
Pause to stabilize only the critical cases.
You accept the pace you can hold.
With stretchers unavailable, you and a volunteer carry patients to imaging by hand.

prompt_script.value: With stretchers unavailable, you and a volunteer carry patients to imaging by hand.

text_script.value: Carry the next patient yourself.
You move fast, breath short.
The hallway clears for a moment.
Organize a human chain.
You trade speed for coordination.
Delay imaging for the stable cases.
You make the hard cut.
A family protests the delay.
A patient deteriorates while waiting for the scanner. You cannot be in two places at once.

prompt_script.value: A patient deteriorates while waiting for the scanner. You cannot be in two places at once.

text_script.value: Stay with the patient and manage without imaging.
You act on clinical judgment alone.
Push for immediate imaging.
You clear the way through the hallway.
Someone else waits longer.
Delegate and continue triage.
You keep the system moving.
Several young siblings arrive together after a single incident. The room goes quiet.

prompt_script.value: Several young siblings arrive together after a single incident. The room goes quiet.

text_script.value: Assign a dedicated nurse and stay involved.
You commit to keeping them alive.
Nura meets your eyes and nods.
Treat and move on to the next case.
You do what you can in the time you have.
Ask Dr. Khaled for additional staff.
He promises to try.
No one arrives.
A patient arrives wrapped in layers you cannot cut quickly. Your tools are missing.

prompt_script.value: A patient arrives wrapped in layers you cannot cut quickly. Your tools are missing.

text_script.value: Use a small blade from a kit.
You improvise with care.
Ask the family to help remove clothing.
Hands work together, silently.
Move to the next case first.
You return when you can.
Without suction, you clear an airway manually while the team waits.

prompt_script.value: Without suction, you clear an airway manually while the team waits.

text_script.value: Continue and finish the procedure.
You keep control with steady hands.
Pause and ask for any alternative device.
A volunteer brings a makeshift tool.
Hand off to another clinician.
You spread the burden.
As you work on one patient, another person grasps your ankle and begs for help.

prompt_script.value: As you work on one patient, another person grasps your ankle and begs for help.

text_script.value: Stay with the procedure you started.
You finish what you began.
The plea fades behind you.
Pause to assess the new patient.
You split attention at a cost.
Call Nura to assist the new patient.
You divide the crisis and keep moving.
A family asks to see their loved one. You have a moment to prepare the room.

prompt_script.value: A family asks to see their loved one. You have a moment to prepare the room.

text_script.value: Take time to present the body with care.
You offer a final kindness.
Move quickly and focus on the living.
You keep the ward moving.
Ask a volunteer to handle the preparation.
You delegate a difficult task.
A father arrives with injured children on a donkey cart. The moment is chaotic and undignified.

prompt_script.value: A father arrives with injured children on a donkey cart. The moment is chaotic and undignified.

text_script.value: Clear a private corner for the family.
You create a small refuge.
Move them directly to the triage line.
You keep the process moving.
Call for extra hands and supplies.
People respond quickly.
The supplies don't arrive.
Untrained volunteers arrive offering help. They are eager but overwhelmed.

prompt_script.value: Untrained volunteers arrive offering help. They are eager but overwhelmed.

text_script.value: Assign them to transport and cleanup.
They steady the flow of the ward.
Pair each with a nurse for supervision.
You reduce risk at the cost of speed.
Turn them away for safety.
You keep standards high.
A few still linger in the doorway.
Someone offers to fetch supplies from a nearby storage room despite the risk.

prompt_script.value: Someone offers to fetch supplies from a nearby storage room despite the risk.

text_script.value: Send the runner with a clear list.
You get what you most need.
Tell them to stay and work here.
You keep the team intact.
Go yourself.
You return short of breath but with supplies.
Your hands tremble as fatigue catches up with you.

prompt_script.value: Your hands tremble as fatigue catches up with you.

text_script.value: Take a two-minute pause.
You reset just enough to continue.
Push through without stopping.
You keep moving, but at a cost.
Ask Nura to take over briefly.
She steps in without question.
Push through anyway; you can?t stop.
Your hands slip as you force yourself to continue.
You try to log names and details with scraps of paper and fading ink.

prompt_script.value: You try to log names and details with scraps of paper and fading ink.

text_script.value: Focus on the most critical cases.
You preserve a small record.
Ask families to help you document.
They fill the gaps you cannot.
Stop documenting to return to care.
You choose action over record.
In a quiet gap, you feel the accumulation of choices you could not avoid.

prompt_script.value: In a quiet gap, you feel the accumulation of choices you could not avoid.

text_script.value: Talk to Nura about what you feel.
She listens without interruption.
Write a short note to yourself.
You capture the truth in a few lines.
Say nothing and return to work.
You keep the line moving.
A young girl named Layla arrives with her aunt, smiling despite the chaos. She has a complicated history and a case file full of contradictions.

prompt_script.value: A young girl named Layla arrives with her aunt, smiling despite the chaos. She has a complicated history and a case file full of contradictions.

text_script.value: Sit with the aunt and listen.
You take notes as the story unfolds.
Skim the referral first.
You flag inconsistencies in the report.
Ask Nura to begin a gentle exam.
Nura returns with calm observations.
Photos show Layla standing with support months ago, yet the report suggests a severe congenital condition. The timeline doesn't fit.

prompt_script.value: Photos show Layla standing with support months ago, yet the report suggests a severe congenital condition. The timeline doesn't fit.

text_script.value: Prioritize the timeline over the label.
You choose the evidence you can verify.
Trust the formal referral.
You lean on the paper record.
Ask for a second opinion within the clinic.
You assemble a quick consult.
You weigh the contradictions out loud. If Dr. Khaled is here, the room becomes a debate instead of a monologue.

prompt_script.value: You weigh the contradictions out loud. If Dr. Khaled is here, the room becomes a debate instead of a monologue.

text_script.value: Debate Dr. Khaled directly.
He pushes back, but he listens.
Speak to Nura instead.
She reflects the contradictions back to you.
Keep it internal and move on.
You carry the uncertainty alone.
A sharp insight lands: the pattern looks less like a rare congenital syndrome and more like a severe, acquired collapse after a hard year. The implication is uncomfortable but actionable.

prompt_script.value: A sharp insight lands: the pattern looks less like a rare congenital syndrome and more like a severe, acquired collapse after a hard year. The implication is uncomfortable but actionable.

text_script.value: Frame it as a cautious alternative, not a verdict.
You share a safer path forward.
Push for immediate local care steps.
You prioritize relief over bureaucracy.
Hold back; the risk of being wrong is high.
You delay the recommendation.
You outline a humane, locally feasible plan that focuses on support and monitoring rather than distant miracles.

prompt_script.value: You outline a humane, locally feasible plan that focuses on support and monitoring rather than distant miracles.

text_script.value: Give the family a clear, simple next step.
They leave with something they can do.
Offer to recheck her weekly.
You commit to a steady watch.
Ask for a second opinion when possible.
You keep the door open without waiting.
Layla returns calmer. The family reports small changes, enough to feel like a bright spot amid the noise.

prompt_script.value: Layla returns calmer. The family reports small changes, enough to feel like a bright spot amid the noise.

text_script.value: Celebrate the small improvement.
You name the progress out loud.
Stay cautious and keep tracking.
You keep the records tight.
Send them with Nura for added support.
Nura walks them out gently.
With Dr. Khaled gone?killed in a strike the staff note as a violation of international humanitarian law?the debate shifts to the corridor with Nura.

prompt_script.value: With Dr. Khaled gone?killed in a strike the staff note as a violation of international humanitarian law?the debate shifts to the corridor with Nura.

text_script.value: Talk through the contradictions with her.
She helps you separate label from timeline.
Ask her how the family is holding up.
She answers quietly, precise and kind.
Keep it brief and return to work.
You carry the argument in silence.

Layla responds to local care. With calcium and vitamin D, her pain eases and her strength returns slowly. You realize she was trapped in transfer limbo, and the lift in her face breaks something open in you. You step into the hallway and weep.

prompt_script.value: Layla responds to local care. With calcium and vitamin D, her pain eases and her strength returns slowly. You realize she was trapped in transfer limbo, and the lift in her face breaks something open in you. You step into the hallway and weep.

text_script.value: A journalist asks for a short update. The hospital?s visibility has consequences.

prompt_script.value: A journalist asks for a short update. The hospital?s visibility has consequences.

text_script.value: Speak plainly about the conditions.
Your words travel beyond the ward.
A planned strike does not arrive. The ward is spared, for now.
Decline and return to work.
You avoid attention for now.
Refer the journalist to administration.
You share the burden of exposure.
A drone strike hits nearby but the hospital is spared. Dr. Khaled returns, shaken and silent.

prompt_script.value: A drone strike hits nearby but the hospital is spared. Dr. Khaled returns, shaken and silent.

text_script.value: Check in with him directly.
He nods and returns to the ledger.
Give him space.
You let him steady himself.
Ask Nura to relay updates.
She manages the handoff.
You find a few minutes of quiet. The ward hums behind the door.

prompt_script.value: You find a few minutes of quiet. The ward hums behind the door.

text_script.value: Step aside and pray.
You steady your breathing.
Post a brief TikTok update.
The release helps, and the clip spreads.
Ask Nura about a quiet nikah.
You both choose a small ceremony.
Make dua for guidance and mercy.
You make the dua and steady yourself.
You and Nura choose a quiet nikah. Later, you share a private moment together before returning to the ward.

prompt_script.value: You and Nura choose a quiet nikah. Later, you share a private moment together before returning to the ward.

text_script.value: Keep it private and return to work.
The promise steadies you both.
Tell one trusted colleague.
A small circle holds the joy.
Keep it strictly between you two.
You return with a quiet strength.
The shift stretches on. You choose how to stay functional.

prompt_script.value: The shift stretches on. You choose how to stay functional.

text_script.value: Take painkillers to push through.
The edge softens, but the line blurs.
Step outside and breathe.
You return a little steadier.
Pray again for patience.
You anchor yourself for the next hour.
Pause and make dua again.
You make the dua and steady yourself.
Exhaustion catches you. A chart is misread and a small error slips through.

prompt_script.value: Exhaustion catches you. A chart is misread and a small error slips through.

text_script.value: Correct it immediately and document.
You own the error and fix it.
Ask Nura to double-check your calls.
She covers for you without judgment.
Move on and hope it doesn?t repeat.
You keep moving, uneasy.
A drone circles low. The courtyard is exposed. Dr. Khaled moves toward the door as the warning comes through.

prompt_script.value: A drone circles low. The courtyard is exposed. Dr. Khaled moves toward the door as the warning comes through.

text_script.value: Pull him back and take his place.
You act without thinking. The strike hits the open space. You do not return.
Shout for him to get back inside.
He hesitates, then moves. The door closes in time.
Freeze. You can't move fast enough.
The moment passes and the ward absorbs the shock.
On a crowded bus leaving the border, a woman offers you a sandwich. The famine is still in your body.

prompt_script.value: On a crowded bus leaving the border, a woman offers you a sandwich. The famine is still in your body.

text_script.value: Take the sandwich.
You accept the food and keep moving.
Refuse and go hungry until Jordan.
You refuse politely and stare out the window.
You step into the exposed space and pull him back. The strike takes you. The ward remembers your name.

prompt_script.value: You step into the exposed space and pull him back. The strike takes you. The ward remembers your name.

text_script.value: You take the sandwich. The bread is plain and good. You close your eyes and let the bus carry you north.

prompt_script.value: You take the sandwich. The bread is plain and good. You close your eyes and let the bus carry you north.

text_script.value: You refuse the sandwich and go hungry. The bus hums toward Jordan while you watch the road.

prompt_script.value: You refuse the sandwich and go hungry. The bus hums toward Jordan while you watch the road.
